title: An Accurate and Rapidly Calibrating Speech Neuroprosthesis
publication: The New England Journal of Medicine
abstract: This study demonstrates a high-accuracy, low-latency speech neuroprosthesis for a person with ALS and severe dysarthria. Using four intracortical microelectrode arrays implanted in the ventral precentral gyrus, researchers decoded attempted speech to enable real-time text and voice communication. The system achieved 99.6% accuracy on a 50-word vocabulary on the first day, and 97.5% accuracy on a 125,000-word vocabulary over 8.4 months, allowing self-paced conversation at approximately 32 words per minute.
